benchmark_details.name: WIKICOLLIDE
benchmark_details.overview: WIKICOLLIDE is the first benchmark capturing real Wikipedia inconsistencies, specifically designed for Corpus-Level Inconsistency Detection.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically quantify corpus-level inconsistencies in Wikipedia and enhance the accuracy of knowledge in large language models.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on performance of CLAIRE and various automated systems against human-annotated labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher AUROC indicates better performance of inconsistency detection systems.
methodology.baseline_results: CLAIRE achieves an AUROC of 75.1% on the test set.
methodology.validation: The reliability of the benchmark was ensured through manual verification of inconsistencies.
